citation.article-title: Campylobacter cinaedi (sp. nov.) and Campylobacter fennelliae (sp. nov.): two new Campylobacter species associated with enteric disease in homosexual men.

p.s: Description of Campylobacter cinaedi sp. nov.
Campylobacter cinaedi (L. gen. n. cinaedi, of a homosexual)
Campylobacter cinaedi as the name for CLO-1 strains.
These organisms have been isolated from the blood and the rectal swabs of homosexual men.

Characteristics of the species have been described [14] and are as follows: growth microaerophilically at 37 C but not 25 C or 42 C; no growth aer- obically or anaerobically; catalase produced; growth in 0.04% triphenyltetrazolium chloride; growth in 1% glycine; nitrate reduced; no growth in 2% NaCl; hippurate not hydrolyzed; hydrogen sulfide not produced in triple-sugar-iron agar; growth inhibited by 30 Î¼g disks of naladixic acid; and intermediate zones of inhibition around 30 jg disks of cephalothin.
The G+C content of the DNA is 37%-38%.
The type strain (165) has been deposited at the American Type Culture Collection, Rockville, Md and is designated ATCC 35683.
